title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Long Island University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy to interview. It was during covid so it was performed over the phone . The hr team was very helpful and information sent via email. Their response to my questions were prompt.
Interview Questions: Experience teaching in the area

title: Research Assisatant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Long Island University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went pretty smoothly, and nothing was surprising about it. The PI asked questions about myself, my reasons for applying to the position, my skills, my relationship with my prior PIs, etc.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me a little bit about yourself? Why this lab? How was carrying your research project out in the previous institution? What statistical tools do you use, and what analyses can you plan, run, and interpret? Etc.

title: Associate Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Long Island University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took a very long time, and when I finally got an offer it was for a different role. They don't have their act together and I got the feeling it was a very sad place
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience working with students from low income families

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Long Island University
Interview Descriptions: Very fair interview process - with extremely kind faculty. Met with all levels of the department before receiving final offer letter. Went through resume and then questions asked were straightforward.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your prior experience.

title: Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Long Island University (New York, NY) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied through their website. Received a phone call for a screening to get to know me better. Was redirected (second round I guess) to higher ups at the location/department that was suited. Interviewed with two people who work directly with admissions. I was basically asked the same question in 20 different ways. To be honest, they are not looking for people who are pushing for admissions and want to see students thrive educationally. They are looking for sales-driven people who know how to trick people. Imagine that. Tricking students into coming to a school that could care less about their students. Read the student reviews on this school, people. One of the interviewers made the interview so difficult for no reason at all. With these types of people in charge, this school will never thrive. Ultimately, I was ghosted. I was never followed up with in regards to my interview. No email. No phone call.
Interview Questions:
Do you feel comfortable making calls in regards to students’ progress in being admitted?
What are the key takeaways from this interview? 
What brings you to higher education/admissions?
What are some ways you completed outreach to the community?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Long Island University
Interview Descriptions: Phone screened with the HR representative who then set me up to be interviewed with the department I'd be working under. I was sent an offer letter within a weeks time. Was able to onboard in about 2 weeks. The entire process took about 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous experiences and how it relates to this position.

title: Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Long Island University
Interview Descriptions: the interviewer didn't know what I was applying for and didn't know my job description. They seemed very flustered and unprofessional.  we spent 10 minutes trying to find the correct job description I would not recommend.
Interview Questions: What are you applying for?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Long Island University
Interview Descriptions: Applied through linkedin. I sent in full cv, cover letter and writing samples. I was asked to send in potential dates for interviews. I had a virtual panel interview. Was asked various questions and they asked me to explain some experiences displayed in my cv.
Interview Questions: why are you interested in this positioin

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Long Island University (New York, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It is smooth and good. They are very clear and precise about what questions they need to ask about the position. They also explained about the projects that I am going to work. Overall the interview was good.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Long Island University
Interview Descriptions:
The marketing team is so desperate for employees that they will contact you on LinkedIn, unprompted, telling you that your credentials are impressive and they'd like to meet with you. That is literally how most of the team was hired - no one specifically applied, but had someone reach out to them requesting an interview.

They do a good job of making positions as this university seem almost too good to be true - because they are. They presented a picture perfect package of the marketing role, including the month of vacation time, benefits, and free education after two years of working there but failed to mention the actual realities of the position. The interview process was a phone interview, two in-person meetings, and a video session with the President of the university (which should have been a red flag). Nothing too difficult to handle, but please know that they were not being truthful or upfront about the position. I wish I had read Glassdoor before accepting this offer.
Interview Questions: What was your biggest professional accomplishment?

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Long Island University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Overall interview process went well. It started with a phone interview and later an in-person interview. They wanted to know why I would make a good fit with the company and explained a lot of new changes heading their way.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Long Island University (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Long process with not much communication. Initially after my application I received an interest call then a month later a phone interview. After this another month and then a video conference doing a pitch about the university. Also an IQ test was required.
Interview Questions: Give a pitch about the university

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Long Island University (Brooklyn, NY) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: interview process was easy at first, but the hiring process took months it was a horrible experience. Interview was fairly easy not many questions. Asked basic question about job experience and why you would be a good fit for the position.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work at LIU

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Long Island University
Interview Descriptions: Unqualified personnel sits with you for about five minutes and chats about life because it's that unprofessional. Some staff members are illeterate and lacking in mental capacity. I wish I was never hired in the first place.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Long Island University (Brooklyn, NY) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: A couple of rounds.  HR followed by technical round. People were very professional and made me feel comfortable. People were very friendly and supportive. Respected interviewee's time and didn't make anyone wait.
Interview Questions: Which tools you work on?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Long Island University (Brookville, Nassau, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was a interviewed fairly quickly. The decision-making process was the longest, being held up by the HR department. They changed the position from Sr. Administrative Assistant to Administrative Assistant and dropped the salary down $5000.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses? Give an example of when you handle=d a difficult situation.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Long Island University
Interview Descriptions: NO interview conducted, because the entire hiring is based on student's GPA and academic performance. once you get good GPA you will be automatically considered for the position. but, for tutor positions, you got to do interviews.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: University Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Long Island University (Brooklyn, NY)
Interview Descriptions: After waiting for the interviewer for about 30 minutes,  I was interviewed for about 30 minutes. The student who serving as a receptionist had no idea where the administrator was.   He seemed to have forgotten that we had an appointment.   Once we got started,  he was very nice and non-chalant.
Interview Questions: How long I had been in the field.

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Long Island University (Old Brookville, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Very nice, short and informal interview process.
The interviewer was very comfortable to talk to.
The interviewer did not ask any hard questions, just very basic ones. Did not ask anything about strengths/ weaknesses.
A huge plus if you already know someone that can recommend you for the job.
Interview Questions:
Are you used to working in a hectic work environment?
How many hours a week can you work?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Long Island University
Interview Descriptions: I wasn't asked any questions and was immediately hired..This is largely because the program I was in was so desperate to hire graduate students than professors so that they can save money, that the position was basically HANDED to me. Nothing about my actual skills were asked.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go here?

title: Practor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Long Island University (Brooklyn, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going. Handing my CV and answering few questions. After few days I received a call for the second interview.After second interview the director of testing center approved my employment to start working in a week
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable giving speech for a big group?

title: Audio Visual Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Long Island University
Interview Descriptions: Typical normal question best trait worst how do you handle stress have you ever used a mixer mic do you have a clean driving record desired salary wiling to work overtime
Interview Questions: how do you wrap a mic cable

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Long Island University
Interview Descriptions: Hiring and interview process is straightforward. Staff will review skills and techniques as well as the safety measures and precautions looked at a laboratory setting
Interview Questions: Expect questions regarding incompatibilities and incompatibilities of chemicals

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Long Island University (Brookville, Nassau, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by one person--this person knew me--so I was hired on the spot without a formal interview process---of course, this took place over 10 years ago.  That's not the hiring practice now.  Now, there is a strict formal interview process that HR oversees and no one gets hired without a thorough screening.
Interview Questions: The most unexpected question was, how soon can you start?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Long Island University (Greenvale, NY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with key leadership and peers; they were all very nice and seemed very dedicated to the university. Once the new president came in nearly all were eliminated, but not because they didn't know what they were doing.
Interview Questions: Experience and strengths

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Long Island University (Greenvale, NY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the professor running the program for the semester and was asked about my prior tutoring experience. It was a short process, and after a review of my past tutoring, my education, and my new class load as a graduate student, I was hired.
Interview Questions: How many credits are you taking this semester?

title: Educational Coordinator Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Long Island University (Brooklyn, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: They asked to look at my resume and cover letter. I was asked a series of questions, had to o a senerio write up and had to do and intense back-round check
Interview Questions: How can we best utilize your skills?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Long Island University (Brooklyn, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The chair contacted my current department about an opening they needed filled. I sent him a resume and cover letter, then the next week met in person and had a brief conversation with him. No teaching demonstration was required.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with diverse populations of students?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Long Island University (Brooklyn, NY) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was recently contacted by LIU-School of Business for an interview for the Secretary IV position.  The interview went well, and the atmosphere was very pleasant.  The first interview was a group interview, and although this was my first time in a group interview setting, I found it to be very comfortable and informative.  The second interview was with the Dean of the Department and it as well was pleasant, the questions asked were your typical interview questions, and the dialogue between myself and the interviewers was great.  I haven't heard from them regarding the position as of yet, I was told within in the next week, I really hope that I nailed it and receive an offer, it is the perfect position for me, and in a University setting, which is what I have been looking for for quite some time.
Interview Questions: How will this position prepare you for your long term goals?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Long Island University (Brooklyn, NY) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Had a contract job at the division of the IT department. And applied for a full time job as one became available. That may be the reason why the process was simple. I was interviewed by the lead engineer and head of IT department.
Interview Questions: Just regular questions about relational databases, ERP and C# programming.

title: Director of Campus Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Long Island University (Greenvale, NY) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Getting the interview was a straightforward process. I simply e-mailed my resume to the designated e-mail address on the Job Posting. I was called for an Interview within a few days. The Interview consisted mainly of the typical questions. "How would you handle a difficult employee?" "What are your biggest Strengths/Weaknesses?" After the Interview, I was told that I would receive a call in a few days.
Interview Questions: What are your biggest strengths & weaknesses?

title: Academic Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Long Island University (Brooklyn, NY) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with three members of current department  including director and academic coordinator
Interview Questions: How do my  plans for next five years work with mission of HEOP?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Long Island University (White Plains, NY) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a week long. It consisted of various presentations on topics that were assigned. It also consisted of a group and individual interview. It was a very tedious process but well worth it. I simply was honest and respectful yet assertive.
Interview Questions: How do you perceive diversity on this campus?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Long Island University (Brooklyn, NY) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Great interview experience. First you get an phone screening which is almost like a real interview. If you succeed you get invited to an interview with 3 different people from the department. Fill out the application, sign consent for background check. A personality test assessment will be given as well.
Interview Questions: What personal qualities can you bring to the table as an admissions counselor. very average question.

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Long Island University (Brooklyn, NY) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Opening through temp agelncy
Interview Questions: N/A
